thread.title: H.S. girls tennis: Carrollton's Fair falls in second round at state
thread.title_full: H.S. girls tennis: Carrollton's Fair falls in second round at state

author: CantonRep.com staff report
title: H.S. girls tennis: Carrollton's Fair falls in second round at state
text: • Polar Bear latest in long family line to reach state tennis tourney... Carrollton sophomore Taylor Fair won her first-round singles match before losing in the second round during Friday’s OHSAA Division II Girls State Tennis Tournament at Lindner Family Tennis Center. Fair defeated Sylvia Goldsmith of Lexington in three sets — 2-6, 6-4, 7-6 (1) — in the opening round. Fair dropped her next match to No. 1 seed Emily Dunbar of Cloverleaf, 6-1, 6-0. In Division I singles, Jackson’s Emily Thomas and Louisville’s Kayla Pukys both lost in the first round. Thomas fell to Dublin Jerome’s Ellee Bullock 6-0, 6-1, while Pukys lost to Emily Thomas of Cincinnati Princeton 6-1, 6-0. In Division I doubles action, Hoover seniors Lynn Daugherty and Sydney Bergman lost to Kyra Jung and Anna Reynolds of Upper Arlington 6-2, 6-3 in the first round. Green sophomores Anne Zivick and Maria Zivick also lost their first-round match to Cincinnati Ursuline’s Jenny Duma and Gabriella O’Conner 6-3, 6-3. The Hoover girls continue their season later this weekend when the Vikings take on Dublin Jerome during Sunday’s semifinals of the OTCA Tournament at Reynoldsburg High School. By CantonRep.com staff report
